results.name: Number A(n,k) of lattice paths from {n}^k to {0}^k using steps that decrement one component by 1 such that for each point (p_1,p_2,...,p_k) we have abs(p_{i}-p_{i+1}) <= 1; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..18, flattened
mathematica: b[l_] := b[l] = If[Union[l] == {0}, 1, Sum[If[l[[i]] == 0 || i>1 && 1 < Abs[l[[i-1]] - l[[i]] + 1] || i<Length[l] && 1<Abs[l[[i+1]] - l[[i]] + 1], 0, b[ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]]-1]]], {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; a[n_, k_] := If[k<2, 1, b[Array[n&, k]]]; Table[Table[a[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 12 2013, translated from Maple *)
